segments.text: I see the water spilling over the sink, and it’s actually kind of funny how the woman doesn’t notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is soaked, but she’s just standing there, drying that plate like it’s the most important thing ever.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so determined to get those cookies, balancing on that stool like a little acrobat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he’ll actually make it down safely or if he’ll end up in the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting patiently, like she knows exactly what’s going to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’ve done this before, and the woman still hasn’t caught on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, like nothing out of the ordinary is happening inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I bet the woman will be surprised when she finally turns around and sees the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and I can’t help but laugh at how sneaky they’re being.
segments.speaker: PAR
